text: Gegham Harutyunyan (born 23 August 1990) is an Armenian professional footballer who plays as a forward for Gandzasar Kapan. ==Club career== Harutyunyan's first senior club was Ulisses, with whom he made his debut for in the 2008 Armenian Cup. Harutyunyan's first appearance in league football came in 2012 vs. Mika. In his final campaign with Ulisses, Harutyunyan scored two goals in twenty-four matches; the last coming against Shirak in May 2014. Gandzasar Kapan completed the signing of Harutyunyan a month later. After scoring twenty-four goals in 2016–17 and 2017–18, which included four goals in a game with Ararat Yerevan on 1 May 2018 - the first was Gandzasar's 400th goal in top-flight history, Harutyunyan departed Armenia to play in Kazakhstan for Shakhter Karagandy on loan two months after. A debut professional appearance arrived on 5 August versus Kairat. ==International career== Harutyunyan was selected in Armenia's senior squad in October 2016 for 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Poland and Romania.
